Items.deck: A bizarre 3D fighting game with a heavy mishmash of anime tropes and a simplistic control scheme (with only ONE attack button).
Items.name: Evil Zone

Items.deck: A Sci-Fi Action-RPG from co-creators of Diablo and Torchlight, featuring heavy sandbox elements and large-scale ship battles.
Items.name: Rebel Galaxy

Items.deck: Gebub's Adventure is an adventure game by John Wallie.
Items.name: Gebub's Adventure

Items.deck: Atari Anthology is a collection of over 80 Atari games released in 2003 as Atari - 80 Classic Games in One! for Microsoft Windows, and in 2004 for the Xbox and PlayStation 2
Items.name: Atari Anthology

Items.deck: Adventure game developed by Microcabin in 1984.
Items.name: Ghost Town

Items.deck: A visual novel developed by Alcot for the PC.
Items.name: Clover Day's

Items.deck: A puzzle game similar to Dr. Mario.
Items.name: Tecmo Stackers

Items.deck: A ZX Spectrum puzzle/logic game.
Items.name: Push Off

Items.deck: A cartoony Green Beret clone. You play as Bazooka Bill. A wide array of weapons are at your disposal and you can switch freely between them.
Items.name: Bazooka Bill

Items.deck: The fourth installment in the QIX series adding a variety of different backgrounds.
Items.name: Twin QIX

Items.deck: Avatar Ninja! is an Xbox Live Indie Game.
Items.name: Avatar Ninja!

Items.deck: An unreleased platformer for the Commodore 64 based off of the Looney Tunes character Daffy Duck.
Items.name: Daffy Duck

Items.deck: Terminator: Future shock was one of the first games to use 100% free mouse-look. The player must solve objectives, avoid radiation and destroy Terminators to complete levels. The player can also man a Jeep or HK Fighter.
Items.name: The Terminator: Future Shock

Items.deck: An indie action game featuring an innovative combat system based around combos and quick reflexes.
Items.name: Lugaru

Items.deck: Pharaoh's Tomb is a platform game created by George Broussard.
Items.name: Pharaoh's Tomb

Items.deck: A interactive novel from Choice of Games.
Items.name: Deathless: The City's Thirst

Items.deck: An action maze game where a mouse policeman has to find stolen goods in a house filled with crooked cats.
Items.name: Mappy

Items.deck: A Famicom Disk System action game based on the Kamen Rider tokusatsu license, developed by Human and published by Bandai.
Items.name: Kamen Rider Black: Taiketsu Shadow Moon

Items.deck: X-Men Origins: Wolverine is a game based upon the movie of the same name that tells the early story of Wolverine.

Items.deck: Deathsmiles Mega Black Label is a heavily altered version of Deathsmiles.

Items.deck: A fantasy MMORPG from Nexon focused on action and adventure. Mount-based combat is at the forefront, with mounts to tame and collect to use in battle.
Items.name: Riders of Icarus

Items.deck: Following the Rock Band formula, The Beatles: Rock Band immerses players into the shoes of the Fab Four as they progress through their career, featuring an exclusively Beatles theme and song list.
Items.name: The Beatles: Rock Band

Items.deck: A next instalment in the Shinseiki GPX Cyber Formula: Road to the Infinity series of PlayStation 2 futuristic racing games
Items.name: Shinseiki GPX Cyber Formula: Road to the Infinity 3

Items.deck: Lady Gaga's new album, Born This Way, is presented here for your tapping pleasure.  It also includes a bunch of bonus tracks from the special edition.
Items.name: Lady Gaga: Born This Way Revenge

Items.deck: Pioneer Balloon is an arcade action game.
Items.name: Pioneer Balloon

Items.deck: A turn-based, freeware strategy game released for DOS in 1992.

Items.deck: PC game.
Items.name: Farm Frenzy 3: Ice Age

Items.deck: An action RPG in the same vein as Secret of Mana, Neugier stars a young boy named Duke who must save his castle from attack.

Items.deck: O Games is responsible for this multiplatform karaoke release.

Items.deck: Cyanide Studio's latest edition in the long running cycling game series.

Items.deck: A browser-based tactics game.

Items.deck: Not to be confused with the Playstation game of the same name, Macross Plus is a vertical-scrolling arcade shoot 'em up by Banpresto.

Items.deck: Solar Jetman is a multi-directional shooter where players must navigate a jet pod through alien planets while juggling the effects of gravity, the towing of cargo and enemy fire.

Items.deck: A prehistoric, retro-inspired, indie action platformer.

Items.deck: Junyong Shenqing is a collection of 3 different Chinese RPGs. The collection includes: "Heroine Anthem The Elect of Wassernixe", "Xianjian Qixia Zhuan 3 Waizhuan: Wen Qing Pian" and "Xin Juedai Shuangjiao 3".
Items.name: Junyong Shenqing

Items.deck: Amazing Tater is the sequel to Kwirk and sees another walking food item pushing blocks and committing suicide when a puzzle is made unwinnable. It is an early Atlus release and was known as Puzzle Boy II in Japan.

Items.deck: Daikaiju no Gyakushu is a Japanese arcade shooter.

Items.deck: An action game where the player controls a hover-tank called a SlamJet which must traverse through four different regions of the subconscious using a variety of weapons and gadgets.

Items.deck: The third band-specific Guitar Hero offering from Activision, Guitar Hero: Van Halen allows you to play as the rock legends themselves.

Items.deck: Resident Evil Zero is a prequel to the long running Resident Evil series, being set merely a day before the Mansion Incident of the original Resident Evil. Zero has players simultaneously control two protagonists: STARS Bravo member Rebecca Chambers, and escaped convict Billy Coen.

Items.deck: The semi-sequel to Legendary Axe/Makkyou Densetsu. The game has seven stages, and was released in Japan in 1990. Despite popular belief in the United States, the game IS a sequel to the Legendary Axe/Makkyou Densetsu and was marketed as such in Japan.

Fly Willow the Whale high through the sky in the magical world of Rainbow Land.
Watch out for the angry sea monster Baron Von Barry who is ever close on Willow‚Äôs tail.

Collect Blubbles, loop the loop, smash the grumpy Thunder Bros enemies and meet friends along the way.

Items.deck: Defend the dungeon in Dungeon Defenders 2. There are several new game modes including a DotA type mode.

Items.deck: Half-Minute Hero: Super Mega Neo Climax is a port of the PSP RPG/puzzle game mashup Half-Minute Hero, released on XBLA and PC. It also includes a new graphical style and an added multiplayer component.
Items.name: Half-Minute Hero: Super Mega Neo Climax

Items.deck: Sports game developed by Nidecom in 1985.
Items.name: Victorious Nine

Items.deck: A real-time strategy game from Mercenary Games.
Items.name: FleetCOMM

Items.deck: King's Field II is a first-person, action-adventure rpg.  This FromSoftware-developed title is the third game in the series, but was renamed for US release because the original was never officially localized.
Items.name: King's Field II

Items.deck: Anno 2070, a part of Ubisoft's strategy franchise Anno, ditches historical settings for a futuristic one. The focus of the game stays true to the series formula of building up cities through exploration and resource management.
Items.name: Anno 2070

Items.deck: Street Fighter meets Elite Beat Agent in this downloadable martial arts-themed versus rhythm game (starring Tha D-O-Double Gizzle).
Items.name: Way of the Dogg

Items.deck: "Age of Empires: Mythologies" for the Nintendo DS is a turn-based adaptation of publisher Microsoft's and developer Ensemble Studios' critically acclaimed "Age of Mythology" for Windows. It is the second such NDS adaptation, with the first being "Age of Empires: Age of Kings" from publisher Majesco and developer Backbone Entertainment.
Items.name: Age of Empires: Mythologies

Items.deck: Skate through a futuristic metropolis as you try to save your kidnapped buddy.
Items.name: Skate City Heroes

Items.deck: The second game in Koei's Nobunaga's Ambition series of historical simulation-strategy games set in the warring states era of Japan, and the first to be released outside of Japan.
Items.name: Nobunaga's Ambition

Items.deck: Michimune must save Miu who has been kidnapped and taken into a land of evil.
Items.name: Seirei Gari

Items.deck: A 3DS game from AQ Interactive where you must make use of the 3DS's Gyro Sensors to guide the main character, "CC", to the goal.
Items.name: Cubic Ninja

Items.deck: POD: Planet of Death is a Futuristic Racing by Ubisoft in 1997. It was designed with the Intel MMX processors in mind and was included as a box set on many computers. A retail version called pod 2.0 was also released with support for 3Dfx voodoo, S3 virge and ATI
Items.name: POD: Planet of Death

Items.deck: Presenting an original story in the same franchise as the comic book series of the same name, The Walking Dead is a five-part adventure game from Telltale that follows the story of a convicted murderer, his guardianship over a young girl, and his co-operation with a roaming group of survivors in a zombie apocalypse.
Items.name: The Walking Dead

Items.deck: A hidden object game similar to Where's Waldo, but the world is animated.
Items.name: Hidden Folks

Items.deck: A puzzle game developed by Strategy Empire.
Items.name: Square Flood

Items.deck: Lack of Love is a game revolving around the survival of an alien creature placed upon a planet being terraformed by robots. The alien must evolve, communicate with the other inhabitants, and and performing simple living functions such as sleeping, urinating, and eating other creatures.
Items.name: L.O.L.: Lack of Love

Items.deck: NHL Hockey is an ice hockey game by EA Sports. For the Sega Mega Drive/Genesis, and PC, it's the first game in the NHL Hockey series.
Items.name: NHL Hockey

Items.deck: A visual novel developed by Alcot Honey Comb.
Items.name: Satsukoi: Yuukyuu Naru Koi no Uta

Items.deck: Old Faithful
Items.name: Old Faithful

Items.deck: One of the early titles released on the Nintendo 64, Wave Race combines challenging courses, realistic water effects, and stunt modes into an aquatic racing experience that still stands as the best the genre has to offer.
Items.name: Wave Race 64

Items.deck: Take on the role of a young farmer and experience the everyday life of an agriculturalist in the most stellar-looking version of "Farming Simulator" yet, now available for Mac as well as Windows.
Items.name: Farming Simulator 2011

Items.deck: Valhyre: The Aftermath is a massive multiplayer online role playing game being developed by Duck's Den Productions Inc. Valhyre takes place in the fantasy world of Denia and will emphasize the role playing aspect of the genre.
Items.name: Valhyre: The Aftermath

Items.deck: An educational Nintendo DS game from Sega based on the franchise of Doraemon - a popular character in Japan. It teaches katakana and hiragana.
Items.name: Kaiteoboeru Doragana

Items.deck: A 3D fighting game exclusive to the Nintendo 64 that uses a unique point-based system to determine who wins.
Items.name: Fighters Destiny
